intro: Cassiniola cuprea, commonly known as the copper cupule, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, shady environments. Cassiniola cuprea is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
